intro: Chrysopsis gossypina subsp. hyssopifolia, commonly known as the blueweed or hyssop-leaved blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in desert or semi-desert environments. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is known for its composite flower heads. Chrysopsis gossypina subsp. hyssopifolia is an annual plant that is adapted to arid conditions and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
